title: Speaking of rebranding... New Reader's Digest logo
content:
Ahem.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228042926im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logoRD_Main_5631.gif)

I am officially shocked.

But at least they are using [Freight Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228042926/http:/www.garagefonts.com/typespecimens_2.html?sku=GF060015X1P2&start=1).

 [‹ Essentials](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228042926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40700 "Go to previous forum topic") [Just looking for something that appears to not be there... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228042926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40707 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ricardo Cordoba

comments.content: Shocked because they updated it, or shocked by how it looks?
Both. Because they updated it and because they chose a sans... They’re so traditional in their content and outlook.

BrandNew comment here... I think the logo is awesome.

Too bad they didn’t update their article topics to try and target the young people the logo is aimed at.
